TextBody:
Hi Colin,

Please let me know if you have availability for a remote session this week Tuesday-Friday and we will take a look together. We would also like to test, if possible, some uploads/file copies to investigate the false positives.

Please let me know some time intervals and your time zone.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

TextBody:
Hi Michael,

Zachary's role is similar to mine, as being part of the Support Team. He is unable to attend the meeting today as it is a Holiday in the US, where he is from.

Even in his absence we should be okay from our side.

We would like to replicate the exact behavior that was causing the issue. I also mentioned file copy as I was not 100% sure what actions determined the issue. If it is upload actions then we can replicate that behavior and generate logs for that.

With the above clarifications, please let me know if you would still like to keep the meeting we have scheduled for today, or if I should pick another interval for next week.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

TextBody:
Hi Michael and Colin,

Thank you for the remote session!

As we spoke we discussed the below topics:
- modules: CAP and eDiscovery
- targeting specific file names for local scanning
- blocking and/or reporting uploads to the internet of files matching a regex expression
- SIEM and Audit Log Backup functionality
- Upgrading the EPP server and the EPP client

If you have any other questions or encounter any issues please let us know by raising a separate ticket and we will take a look together.

We are closing this ticket.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com
